intro: Cordiera myrciifolia var. myrciifolia, commonly known as the red-leafed cordiera, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that often turn reddish in cooler temperatures. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for shade gardens and container planting.
